title: Israel and Hamas agree to ‘first phase’ of plan to end fighting and release hostages, Trump says
byline: Israel and Hamas have agreed to the “first phase” of his peace plan to pause fighting and release at least some hostages and prisoners, U.S. President Donald Trump said Wednesday.

title: Showers expected in several provinces after 1pm
byline: Showers or thundershowers will occur at most parts of the island after 1.00 p.m.

title: 5-year-old child drowns in swimming pool during training activity
byline: A 5-year-old child tragically drowned in a swimming pool in Nugegoda last evening (8), police stated.

title: UN Secretary-General welcomes Gaza ceasefire deal
byline: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres on Wednesday welcomed the announcement of a ceasefire and hostage-release agreement in the Gaza Strip.

title: 47 Indian fishermen taken into custody for poaching in Sri Lankan waters
byline: Five Indian boats along with 47 fishermen taken into custody by the Sri Lanka Navy in seas off Talaimannar and Delft Island.

title: Oil prices fall on Gaza plan, fading Middle East risk premium
byline: Oil prices fell in early trade on Thursday after Israel and Hamas agreed to the first phase of a plan to end the war in Gaza, weighing on oil’s war risk premium and pushing investors to sell.

title: Re-scrutinized results of O/L exam released
byline: The re-scrutinized results of the 2024 G.C.E. Ordinary Level Examination have been released.

title: Fire breaks out at Tea Factory in Nallathanniya
byline: A fire broke out at a tea factory in Nallathanniya at approximately 1:00 a.m. today (9).

title: Google to power LA28 with cloud infrastructure, AI tools
byline: Google will serve as the official cloud provider of the Los Angeles 2028 Olympic and Paralympic Games and has joined LA28 as a founding partner, organisers said on Wednesday, in a deal that also extends to Team USA and NBCUniversal’s U.S. coverage.

title: UN peacekeeping forces to be cut 25% due to budget strains: Official
byline: The United Nations will be forced to reduce its peacekeeping forces worldwide by around 25 per cent due to a lack of funding, largely linked to US aid cuts, a senior UN official said on Wednesday (Oct 8).

title: Police seize over 18kg of narcotic from duo arrested in Kadawatha
byline: A woman and a man, who were arrested while at a house in Pahala Biyanwila, Kadawatha, last evening (8), were in possession of over 18 kilograms of narcotics, police said.

title: Dolly Parton says ‘I ain’t dead yet’ after sister sparked alarm
byline: Country singer Dolly Parton sought to reassure fans about her health on Wednesday (Oct 8) after comments by her sister stoked concern that the Grammy winner was near death.

title: Sri Lanka marks 151st World Post Day today
byline: Today (9) marks the 151st World Post Day, which is being commemorated around the globe.

title: Udaya Gammanpila appears before Bribery Commission
byline: The Leader of the Pivithuru Hela Urumaya, former Member of Parliament Udaya Gammanpila, has appeared before the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption, a short while ago.

title: Afghan Taliban foreign minister begins first India visit
byline: Afghanistan’s UN-sanctioned foreign minister arrived in India on Thursday, the first visit by a top Taliban leader since they returned to power in 2021 following the withdrawal of US-led forces.

title: Colombo Port generates Rs. 32 billion profit in first 8 months of 2025
byline: The Colombo Port has recorded a net profit of Rs. 32.2 billion during the first eight months of 2025, the Ministry of Transport, Highways, Ports, and Civil Aviation stated.

title: 29 mobile phones found in Boossa high-security prison
byline: A total of 29 mobile phones have been recovered today from wards A, C, and D of the Boossa High-Security Prison, which houses some of Sri Lanka’s most dangerous criminals.

title: France’s Macron will appoint new prime minister in next 48 hours
byline: French President Emmanuel Macron will appoint a new prime minister in the next 48 hours, his office said on Wednesday, adding that a majority of lawmakers were against holding a snap parliamentary election amid France’s worst crisis in decades.

title: IMF reaches staff-level agreement with Sri Lanka on fifth review
byline: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) and the Sri Lankan authorities have reached a staff-level agreement on economic policies to conclude the Fifth Review of Sri Lanka’s reform program supported by the IMF’s Extended Fund Facility.

title: 13 bank accounts linked to Backhoe Saman’s wife and associates frozen: CID informs court
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) informed the Colombo Magistrate’s Court today (9) that 13 bank accounts belonging to Shadhika Lakshani — the wife of Backhoe Saman, who is currently in remand custody — and her close associates have been frozen.

title: PUCSL to announce final decision on electricity tariff revision shortly
byline: Approximately 500 individuals submitted opinions and suggestions during public consultation sessions held in relation to the third electricity tariff revision proposed for this year, the Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) stated.

title: Israeli hostages may be released as early as Saturday after Gaza ceasefire deal
byline: Israeli hostages may be released as early as Saturday under a US plan to end the war in Gaza and the country’s military will complete the first part of a partial withdrawal from the enclave within 24 hours of the deal being signed, said a source briefed on details of the agreement.

title: Starmer meets Modi on his first visit to India
byline: Sir Keir Starmer has met Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi on his first visit to the country.

title: Indian nationals continue to dominate tourist arrivals figures
byline: A total of 34,046 tourists have arrived in the country thus far in the month of October, data from the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) shows.

title: IMF asks Sri Lanka to beef up anti-graft operations
byline: The International Monetary Fund asked cash-strapped Sri Lanka on Thursday to strengthen its anti-corruption agency and accelerate prosecutions after a review of a bailout that began in 2023.

title: Police issue clarification on reports circulating about mastermind behind Easter Sunday Attacks
byline: The Police Media Division has stated that a false news report is circulating on social media claiming that retired Senior Deputy Inspector General of Police Ravi Seneviratne told the Parliamentary High Posts Committee that the mastermind behind the Easter Sunday attacks has been identified and that India is behind it.

title: Two arrested for defrauding Rs. 200 million by promising employment in Europe
byline: Two individuals connected to a large-scale scam involving nearly Rs. 200 million, falsely promising jobs in European countries, have been arrested by officers of the Special Investigations Unit of the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment.

title: Ferrari lifts the hood on EV tech in maiden electric car
byline: Ferrari has unveiled the technology which will power its hotly-anticipated first electric car, the Elettrica, as the 78-year-old luxury Italian sportscar maker looks to add battery power to its hybrid and petrol-engine models.

title: Joy in Israel and Gaza as ceasefire and hostage deal is signed
byline: Israel and the Palestinian militant group Hamas signed an agreement on Thursday (Oct 9) to cease fire and free Israeli hostages in exchange for Palestinian prisoners, in the first phase of US President Donald Trump’s initiative to end the war in Gaza.

title: Govt to provide benefits to unaddressed retirees in 2026 budget – Minister
byline: Minister of Public Administration, Provincial Councils and Local Government, Dr. Chandana Abayaratne, announced that a significant number of retired public servants whose salaries were not increased in the 2025 Budget will receive due benefits in the 2026 Budget.

title: Nobel Prize in literature goes to Hungarian novelist for work confronting ‘apocalyptic terror’
byline: The 2025 Nobel Prize in literature has been awarded to László Krasznahorkai, a Hungarian novelist who said his dark and difficult novels aim to examine reality “to the point of madness.”

title: Derana Cinema of Tomorrow winner “Vihanga Premaya” secures global release via Lanka Events & IFMN
byline: Lanka Events, the leading overseas Sri Lankan film distributor based in Sydney and a strategic partner of TV Derana, has announced the global release of Vihanga Premaya (Peacock Lament), the 2025 Derana-Lux Cinema of Tomorrow Film Award winner for Best Film, directed by acclaimed filmmaker Dr. Sanjeewa Pushpakumara.

title: Cardinal Ranjith urges Sri Lankans to preserve heritage, warns against becoming slaves to foreign ideologies
byline: His Eminence Archbishop of Colombo, Cardinal Malcolm Ranjith has stated that Sri Lanka should not become subservient to the conditions imposed by the International Monetary Fund (IMF) and foreign nations, emphasizing that such dependency undermines the country’s self-respect.
